To inspect real-time troubleshooting issues for the local kiosk in the RVM project, you can implement a logging and monitoring system that collects and analyzes data from the kiosk in real-time. This system can be used to detect and diagnose issues as they occur, allowing for quick resolution of any problems.

Here are some possible components of a logging and monitoring system for the RVM local kiosk:

1. Log collection: Set up a system to collect logs from the kiosk, including system logs, application logs, and error logs. These logs should be forwarded to a centralized location for analysis.
2. Data analysis: Use a data analysis tool to process the logs and identify any anomalies or issues. This tool can provide real-time alerts and notifications when an issue is detected.
3. Dashboard: Implement a dashboard that displays real-time data about the kiosk's performance, including usage statistics, error rates, and system health. This dashboard can provide an overview of the kiosk's status and allow for quick identification of any issues.
4. Remote access: Allow remote access to the kiosk's system and logs to facilitate troubleshooting and issue resolution.
5. API integration: Integrate with the government API to monitor any issues related to compliance or regulatory requirements.

By implementing a logging and monitoring system, you can ensure that any issues with the local kiosk are detected and addressed in real-time, minimizing downtime and improving the user experience.
